CONVERSATION GROUP: He'll be carrying an ancient elven artifact, very valuable. I need it back... oh, and him too... maybe he just got lost out there and can't find his way back

BK Some of these changes felt a bit rough. I believe this was meant to be a consent line.
Do you want us to find your brother or this artifact?

BK - pretty sure his name is Richard
I need that artifact.  This entire trip will be a disaster without it.  If you find Wildred, get that artifact back.  Then send him back here. I could use his help getting all packed up.
We found an artifact in the mercenaries' hideout. Maybe it was with your brother.
May I have the artifact?  After I sell it I should be able to hire some competent help.

I trimmed this because too many reward givers are saying "it is not much". Going to give the player's a complex.
BK  Thank you, my friend. Here. Take this. It's not much, but you provided some closure, and that's worth a little something.
I'll get my cart ready, now. There's no more reason to delay, anyway.
No... I.... Fine. At least I have the my other goods. My brother is gone! Now how will I get all this packed up in time?!
BK removed the condition here, default = true

BK I did not understand this sentence. I think the lying bit is distracting (and the player was caught on the previous line).
BK Thank you. It means a lot that you were willing to admit his treachery only after I caught you lying about it.  At least I have what's important, my artifact.
My brother's dead... and every day we spend out here is another cut taken out of my profits.
We never did find my brother... and every day we spend out here is another cut taken out of my profits.
Thanks. I'm sure he'll turn up. I'm not too worried, I guess.
I can't stand by and let a man suffer from abuse.  He deserves a chance to start a new life.
The only thing he deserves is a whipping! Tollin is going to hear about this!
